channel.title: VE3ZSH's Writings
channel.description: Essays, writings, and tutorials about technology I thought worth sharing.

item.title: Charcuterie
item.description: One of my favourite charcuterie boards.

item.title: Great Evil Characters
item.description: My strategy for creating evil characters that are both believable people and clearly evil.

item.title: Omurice Bear
item.description: A cute teddy bear made of tomato flavoured rice and mozzarella cheese under a fluffy blanket of French omelette.

item.title: Knowledge vs. Wisdom
item.description: The wise programmer is unafraid to seem novice.

item.title: My Comments In Response to Ontario Bill 212
item.description: My comments submitted in response to Ontario Bill 212.

item.title: Why I Removed My XSLT Feed Template
item.description: Explaining the reasons why I finally removed the XSLT feed template from my blog index feed.

item.title: The Policy
item.description: Satire about the current sad state of the web and how it treats users.

item.title: It's not my job to…
item.description: I finally figured out why people who start a sentence this way are generally scummy people.

item.title: Spooky Python File Descriptors
item.description: File like objects can behave in unexpected ways at times if you think too much of them like Python objects.

item.title: Team Based Development Tips
item.description: Assortment of tips and tricks I've picked up for working with teams of developers. Nothing groundbreaking, mostly things learned from others I've found useful.

item.title: Big-O of Zero—Ο(0)
item.description: The speed of not doing work is key to software performance.

item.title: Tech Debt Just Means Messy
item.description: Doubling down on a bad metaphor, a response.

item.title: How To Practice
item.description: A guide to establishing a habit of professional practice.

item.title: Hosting Options
item.description: A taxonomy and pros/cons list for various website hosting methods in 2023.

item.title: Google Calendar Webcal/iCal URL
item.description: A quick guide to getting the webcal formatted feed of a public Google calendar. Plus a bonus RSS URL for YouTube channels.

item.title: Rump's Royal Pain
item.description: A deeper look at floating point numbers and when they go wrong.

item.title: If DevOps, Why Not QASec?
item.description: A possible future of quality software where security research skills help revitalise a dying art.

item.title: Human Responsibility Playbook
item.description: A pessimistic view of how people tend to handle the big issues in life.

item.title: Tech Debt is Silly
item.description: The metaphor of technical debt is not only barely helpful to explain the concept, it actively misleads non-technical people. We need a different metaphor.

item.title: 10 Years as a Career Programmer
item.description: Reflections on my last first 10 years as a professional software developer.

item.title: Anecdata
item.description: A collection of anecdotes about an observed phenomena. Just as useless as a single anecdote.

item.title: UUIDs and B-Trees and Legacy, Oh My!
item.description: An adventure in improving the performance of a legacy system.

item.title: Graceful Gunicorn Timeouts
item.description: How to gracefully catch and cleanup when your Python web service is going to timeout.

item.title: Introducing Programmer Talks
item.description: Just a bit of discussion about the new programmer talks page I've created for this site.

item.title: How To Run a Casual D&D One Shot
item.description: A friend is sizing up a D&D one shot for family this holiday season to parry the dreaded tabletop routine. I share the advice I gave her in case it proves useful to you.

item.title: Animated Reel Menu Update
item.description: Quick update about the state of my animated reel menu. Turns out we can optimise it by using the transform CSS style after all.

item.title: Decentralized Secret Management
item.description: This post explores how you can manage secret credentials in a software project without the use of a centralized credential management server.

item.title: RSS as HTML
item.description: Have you seen the RSS Feed for this blog? Turns out the major browsers all support a decent subset of XSLT.

item.title: Animated Reel Menu
item.description: Someone suggested I write a post about how my menu button works. This is that post.

item.title: How To Secure Application Credentials
item.description: You've written code that needs to make authenticated calls. How do you securely manage your credentials?
